p: Among pathogens, Sturrock et al . [ 40] describe two groups. The first group infects stressed plants and will become more problematic under climate change-induced stress. Examples include M. phaseolina and canker diseases of trees caused by opportunistic fungi, including the emerging pathogen of oak, Biscogniauxia mediterranea. This fungus was first described in Mediterranean oaks; however, it emerged in Slovenia in 2006 [ 41] following low rainfall and above average temperatures. As increased aridity spreads north, this pathogen is expected to follow [ 42].
